attributes.action: ban supermarkets charging extra for item if a person doesn't have a loyalty card
attributes.additional_details: we want low prices for all customers, not just for those that use one of the said cards.
attributes.background:
we want the goverment to force a rule that no supermarket can charge extra if the person doesn't have a loyalty card.
you have to be over 18 to obtain a loyalty card and making it so everyone under that age has to pay the over inflated prices that the supermarkets are charging.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether to offer discounts for loyalty card holders are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.
